TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit QualifiedAce extends System.Security.AccessControl.KnownAce

Docs.summary: Represents an Access Control Entry (ACE) that contains a qualifier. The qualifier, represented by an object, specifies whether the ACE allows access, denies access, causes system audits, or causes system alarms. The QualifiedAce class is the abstract base class for the and classes.
Gets a value that specifies whether the ACE allows access, denies access, causes system audits, or causes system alarms.
Docs.value: A value that specifies whether the ACE allows access, denies access, causes system audits, or causes system alarms.
Docs.returns: A value that specifies whether the ACE allows access, denies access, causes system audits, or causes system alarms.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance unsigned int8[] GetOpaque() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the opaque callback data associated with this object.
Docs.returns: An array of byte values that represents the opaque callback data associated with this object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Opaque callback data is present only in callback Access Control Entries (ACEs).

Docs.value: An array of byte values that represents the opaque callback data associated with this object.

Docs.summary: Specifies whether this object contains callback data.
Docs.value: if this object contains callback data; otherwise, false.
Docs.returns: if this object contains callback data; otherwise, false.

Docs.summary: Gets the length of the opaque callback data associated with this object. This property is valid only for callback Access Control Entries (ACEs).
Docs.value: The length of the opaque callback data.
Docs.returns: The length of the opaque callback data.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetOpaque(unsigned int8[] opaque) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of byte values that represents the opaque callback data for this object.
Docs.summary: Sets the opaque callback data associated with this object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Opaque callback data is present only in callback Access Control Entries (ACEs).
